title.narrative: UNDP Cambodia Community Based Adaptation Program (CCBAP) 2011-2015

description.narrative: The Cambodia Comunity Base Adaptation programmes (CCBAP)aiming to contribute to the capacity development of local Cambodian non-governmenal organizations(NGOs), Community Base Organization (CBOs), local authorities(Commune Councils) and local communities in order to integrate and implement the community climate change adaptation and mitigation.

The Cambodia Comunity Base Adaptation programmes (CCBAP)aiming to contribute to the capacity development of local Cambodian non-governmenal organizations(NGOs), Community Base Organization (CBOs), local authorities(Commune Councils) and local communities in order to integrate and implement the community climate change adaptation and mitigation.

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: Between December 2010 and December 2015, the Cambodia Community-Based Adaptation Programme (CCBAP) supported 71 projects through 44 local non-government organizations (NGOs) and eight community-based organizations (CBOs) to implement integrated community-based adaptation measures. These measures supported 22,618 families (96,365 people / 50,792 women) in 428 villages, 113 communes and 59 districts of 21 provinces. These families had their basic capacity to deal with climate hazards enhanced through the programme, which increased the resilience of poor and vulnerable communities to climate change impacts through implementing innovative activities in water and agriculture. The programme rehabilitated water infrastructure such as canals, water gates, community ponds, family ponds and open wells, and promoted knowledge sharing on climate change. The programme achieved 95 percent of its target. CCBAP successfully strengthened the capacity of local NGOs and CBOs in terms of proposal writing and project implementation for climate change adaptation projects through various approaches, such as training, workshops, field assessments, field monitoring, meetings and coaching. CCBAP was implemented in 145 target communes using Vulnerability Reduction Assessment (VRA) tools. VRA is used to raise awareness on climate change, develop project proposals and implement projects . As a result, 74 percent of the 145 target communes have integrated climate change adaptation activities into their Commune/Sangkat Development Plan (CDP) and Commune Investment Plan (CIP). CCBAP was successful in building capacity on climate change by training NGOs/CBOs and encouraging them to work closely with local authorities and communities. All CCBAP partner projects were integrated into CDPs and CIPs. There were nine case studies and human interest stories, as well as 16 photo stories developed and published from 71 projects. All case studies and stories were distributed and shared during CCBAP reflection workshops, farmer forums, and other events at both national and international levels. They were also posted online at http://www.kh.undp.org and YouTube. Gender awareness is important when implementing community-based adaptation to address climate change, as women perceive the impacts of climate change differently to men. With support from the UNDP regional centre, the Small Grants Programme (SGP)/CCBAP team was able to develop and implement a Gender Action Plan, which identified key gender goals for the programme to achieve.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
